poll.question: Prior to this presentation, have you heard of Udacity?

poll.feedback: Thanks for your answer -- watch the video to see if you're correct!
poll.question:
The title of the presentation, "Expert Evaluation of 300 Projects per Day", was written based on the status of Udacity's project review system in October 2015. Now, in April 2016, that number has changed.
If the review system reviewed 300 projects per day in October 2015, how many projects do you predict are reviewed per day now?

poll.feedback: Thanks for your answer! Watch the video to see if you're correct.
poll.question: One metric we use to evaluate the Udacity project review system is student satisfaction, as rated on a 5-point scale. Students rate each evaluation they receive on a five-point scale, and give feedback to the reviewer. What do you predict is the average student satisfaction rating?

poll.feedback: Thanks for your answer! Watch the video to see if you're correct.
poll.question: The third metric we use to evaluate the project evaluation system is the turn-around time. We want students to get feedback from the reviewers as quickly as possible. What do you predict is the average turnaround time? In other words, if you are a student in one of Udacity's programs and submit a project to be evaluated by a human reviewer, how long on average do you predict you'll have to wait to receive your feedback?
